results.title: Quintet
results.creator_credit: Robert Altman and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Robert Altman’s “Quintet” was received with almost universal derision when it was released in 1979. He had made his reputation with very contemporary, very insisive and very American films. “Quintet” is strikingly different: heavily symbolic, with a mannerist visual palette, it was a departure for Altman and sees him explore themes associated with European existentialism. In a desolate future Ice-Age the remaining inhabitants of Earth are facing their extinction. Paul Newman plays a hunter, returning to his birthplace, accompanied by a pregnant woman (a startling occurrence in a world where most people are no longer able to reproduce). Her murder leads him to a confrontation with the players of Quintet, an elaborate and violent game which is the main activity of the future. As he becomes more involved in the strategies and rules of Quintet, he finds himself losing his identity. This complex and philosophical science-fiction film, creates a future as it may have been envisaged by Kafka and is a uniquely original meditation on the struggle and meaning of human “free will”. Undeniably difficult and ambitious, the film deserves a more serious critical engagement than that offered by contemporary English-language critics. Also stars Vittorio Gassman, Bibi Anderson and Fernando Rey.

results.title: Quo Vadis
results.creator_credit: Mervyn LeRoy, Sam Zimbalist and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Describes Rome at the time of Nero, focusing on a Roman commander who falls in love with a Christian girl and becomes a convert himself. A spectacular film, at its most effective where it examines the lives of the early Christians. The Miklos Rozsa score was based on music of the time. Starring Deborah Kerr, Robert Taylor and Peter Ustinov.

results.title: Kingdom of David: the saga of the Israelites [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Mitch Wilson, Carl Byker and Oregon Public Broadcasting
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Empires”.
Kingdom of David: the saga of the Israelites is the story of one of the most profoundly influential religions, Judaism. This illuminating work features historical re-enactments, as well as interviews with contemporary scholars, to recall the ancient worlds depicted in the Bible. Episode 1. “By the rivers of Babylon”: In 586 BC, the Israelites were exiled in Babylon and seemed destined to disappear; but they fought back by writing a book using Judean stories to explain the present disastrous situations - the Bible. Episode 2. “The Book and the sword”: In 458 BC a scribe named Ezra arrived in Jerusalem from Babylon; gathering the mostly illiterate Judeans together he read the Bible to them. In the following years study of the Bible became an essential part of Jewish life. Episode 3. “The End of days”: When the Roman General Pompeii led his legions into the land of Judea in 63 BC it was the beginning of a clash of cultures that grew into one of the most brutal conflicts in history. Terrorism, political assassination, starvation and crucifixion dominated the landscape, ending with the Roman sack of Jerusalem and the destruction of the Temple in 70 AD. From the aftermath, two new religions rose: rabbinical Judaism and Christianity. Episode 4. “The Gifts of the Jews”: In 132 AD Jewish zealots rebelled against Rome’s legions, forcing them to withdraw from the region. The Romans returned with a vast army, slaughtered nearly 600,000 Jews, changed the name of the region from Judea to Palestine and banned all Jews from Jerusalem. Many Jews fled to distant lands only to face another challenge - a breakaway form of Judaism called Christianity.

results.title: Quigley
results.creator_credit: Simon Wincer, Alex Rose, Stanley O'Toole and Pathe Entertainment
results.brief_description: Tom Selleck stars as Matthew Quigley, an American hired gun who answers a “Help Wanted” ad and finds himself in Australia. Alan Rickman plays the evil, British cattle rancher who hires Quigley. Quigley refuses the job and is left stranded in the outback with a crazy woman called Cora (Laura San Giacomo). Essentially a western in an outback setting, the film also features Chris Haywood, Tony Bonner and Ben Mendelson.

results.title: Quiddity tree
results.creator_credit: Marvin Albert and Marvin Albert Films
results.brief_description: This prize winning film is a fantasy about man and nature, in which the inter-relationships of man and his environment are symbolically revealed. Experimental in its treatment, the film carries the message that man must preserve his environment in every way possible - not destroy it.

results.title: Quiz show
results.creator_credit: Robert Redford, Michael Nozik, Julian Krainin, Michael Jacobs and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: Ralph Fiennes and John Turturro play contestants battling for huge cash prizes and instant fame on a top-rated quiz show in the mid-1950s. When charges surface that the hit program is fixed and players are being given the answers, it becomes far more than a game. Contestants, producers and the network itself get caught in the centre of an escalating scandal. Nominated for the 1994 Best Picture Academy Award and based on a true story that shocked the United States, this is a very compelling film.
